title: Saratoga National Historical Park: Public Involvement
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Public Involvement              Public Involvement         An original wayside exhibit panel from the 1970s and a current wayside panel from the park. Saratoga National Historical Park  Battlefield Wayside Exhibit Planning Saratoga National Historical Park is seeking public input on a new plan for over 60 wayside exhibits along its 10-mile scenic tour road. The new plan focuses on an improved understanding and orientation to the Battles of Saratoga, and includes new scholarship, new artwork, new human interest stories, and future opportunities for mobile web applications. A public comment meeting on Wednesday, August 13th, 2014 unveiled the plans.    A copy of the informational packet from the meeting is available as a downloadable PDF file (13 MB). A copy of the final Concepts and Themes Document for the project is available as a downloadable PDF file (227 kb) The press release from the public comment meeting is available as a downloadable PDF file (117 kb).   Comments on the Wayside Enhancement Plan may be made by e-mailing Gina Johnson, or by mailing to: Saratoga National Historical Park attn: Gina Johnson 648 Route 32 Stillwater, NY 12170
